page.title: 19Housing in Twyford Area
page.content: The majority of houses in the area are of red brick reflecting the local industry.Only 5 thatched cottages remain in Twyford.Nearly all the houses have a garden.A sad sign of the times is that as older inhabitants die,mature properties are being modernised at the expense of character.The few new properties are tending to be larger,family homes and this trend is changing the nature of the population.Rented accomodation is declining as council properties are being purchased by their tenants under a government scheme.Consequently the "council look" is being lost as houses are improved and altered to suit individual needs and tastes.The large Mnanor house at Poundon is still used as a family home whereas Twyford Manor is now converted into flats.Twyford Grange is now an Old People's Home.
